meanings.definition: The concise and abbreviated style of writing used in telegrams.
meanings.sent1: In telegraphese, words are shortened to save time and money.
meanings.sent2: The telegram was written in telegraphese to convey the message quickly.
meanings.sent3: I tried writing a letter in telegraphese, but it ended up looking like a secret code.
meanings.sent4: Her notes were like telegraphese, conveying only the essential information.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained telegraphese by comparing it to texting with limited characters.

meanings.definition: To communicate using a telegraphic style of writing.
meanings.sent1: He telegraphesed the urgent news to his family back home.
meanings.sent2: They decided to telegraphese the details to ensure a quick response.
meanings.sent3: The students telegraphesed their notes to each other during the exam.
meanings.sent4: She telegrapheses her thoughts in short, concise messages.
meanings.sent5: The team telegraphesed their strategy to win the game in a few words.
